concept.title: Before You Begin
concept.shortdesc: Before you start this tutorial, you'll need to do a few things:

ol.li:
tutorialprerequisitesDownload sample data.
You can download sample data from the StreamSets website. You'll need a login to the password-protected section of the site - it just takes a moment to set up an account.
Sample data URL: URL

Set up origin, destination, and error directories.
We will be prefixing output and error files, so for convenience you can use the same directory for all three file types. If you prefer to use separate directories, set up the following:
Origin directory - Save the sample data in a directory local to the . Make sure that the user who started the has permission to read from the directory.
Destination directory - The pipeline writes output records to file. Consider where you want to write the output files and make sure the user has write permission for the directory.
Error directory - The pipeline also writes error records to file - though you can configure it to write to Kafka if you prefer. Make sure the user has write permission for the error directory.

The should be installed and running, but not running other pipelines.
At this time, a instance can run a single pipeline, but you can install multiple instances on the same machine.change this soon?

To create and run the pipeline, you should have a login with the creator and manager roles or the admin role.
If using the default logins shipped with the , you can use the admin login: admin / admin.
